Kraft General Foods yesterday granted D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles of New York a second chance to handle advertising for the Crystal Light sugar-free powdered drink mix brand. The account, with billings estimated at $10 million to $15 million, had been at Ogilvy & Mather New York for nine months after leaving D.M.B.& B. in April.

D.M.B.& B. was awarded the account after a two-month review that was limited to Ogilvy and two other Kraft General Foods agencies: Grey Advertising and Young & Rubicam, both of New York. D.M.B.& B.'s appointment is the second recent account gain for the agency from Kraft General Foods, reversing a trend during which the company had been withdrawing accounts, including Crystal Light, from the agency.
